p: Ten medicinal herbs were associated with anti-aging: Ginseng Radix (Z = 4.26), Rehmanniae Radix (Z = 6.36), tuberous root of Ophiopogon japonicus (Thunb.) Ker Gawl. (Liriopis Tuber) (Z = 7.05), tuberous root of Asparagus cochinchinensis (Lour.) Merr. (Asparagi Tuber) (Z = 6.64), root cortex of Lycium barbarum L. (Lycii Radicis Cortex) (Z = 5.25), fruit of Lycium barbarum L. or Lycium chinense Mill. (Lycii Fructus) (Z = 4.94), seed of Cuscuta chinensis Lam. (Cuscutae Semen) (Z = 5.98), seed of Nelumbo nucifera Gaertn. (Nelumbinis Semen) (Z = 4.92), fruit of Prunus mume (Siebold) Siebold & Zucc. (Mume Fructus) (Z = 8.74), and root of Euphorbia kansui S.L.Liou ex S.B.Ho (Euphorbiae Kansui Radix) (Z = 5.22). Mume Fructus was the only herb in the “wrinkle” subgroup; the other herbs belonged to the “rejuvenation” subgroup.
